section.title: Have got
section.sectiontitle: Use have got to talk about our possessions and family / friends.
section.sectiontitle2: Use have got after I, you, we and they. The contracted form is 've got.
section.text3: I <Font color='#A6416E'>have got</Font>, you <Font color='#A6416E'>have got</Font>
section.text3a: I<Font color='#A6416E'>'ve got</Font>, you<Font color='#A6416E'>'ve got</Font>
section.text4: we <Font color='#A6416E'>have got</Font>, they <Font color='#A6416E'>have got</Font>
section.text4a: we<Font color='#A6416E'>'ve got</Font>, they<Font color='#A6416E'>'ve got</Font>

section.title: Have got
section.sectiontitle: Use has got after he, she and it. The contracted form is 's got.
section.text1a: he <Font color='#A6416E'>has got</Font>, she <Font color='#A6416E'>has got</Font>, it <Font color='#A6416E'>has got</Font>
section.text2a: he<Font color='#A6416E'>'s got</Font>, she<Font color='#A6416E'>'s got</Font>, it<Font color='#A6416E'>'s got</Font>
section.sectiontitle2: Make questions with have/has + subject + got. Don't use contractions in questions.

section.title: Have got
section.text1a: I have not got a car.
section.text2a: She has not got a sister.
section.text3: I have not got a car.
